block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater
CHAPPAQUA -- ''The Who's Tommy'' by Saw Mill Summer Theater. Today at 2 p.m. and Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $16. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 923-7529.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater
CHAPPAQUA -- ''The Who's Tommy'' by Saw Mill Summer Theater. Today at 2 p.m. and Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $16. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 923-7529.
CROTON FALLS -- Staged reading of three short plays adapted from the book ''Blonde'' by Joyce Carol Oates. Today at 4 p.m. Donation: $12. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.

ELMSFORD -- ''Sound of Music.'' Matinee and evening performances Wednesdays through Sundays. Through September. Tickets: $46 to $66, including dinner. Discounts at some performances for students, people 62 and older and children. Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.

GARRISON -- Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival performs ''Taming of the Shrew.'' Today at 6 p.m., with discussion with actors and the director after the show; Wednesday and Thursday at 7 p.m. and next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Through Aug. 27. Tickets: $19 to $30, with discounts available for students, people 65 and older and children, except Saturday evenings. Picnicking encouraged, with picnic dinners available to those reserving two days in advance. Cost: $16 and $18. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-9575.

HARTSDALE -- The musical, ''Secret Life of Walter Mitty.'' Presented by Hartsdale Players. Friday and next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 4 p.m. Through Aug. 20. Tickets: $15; students, people 62 and older and children, $12. St. Paul's Methodist Church, 130 North Central Avenue. (914) 961-2055.
NYACK -- ''Forbidden Broadway.'' Thursday to next Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25 to $40. Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center, 117 Main Street. (845) 358-6333.

SCARSDALE -- ''Pippin'' by Scarsdale Summer Music Theater. Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15; students, people 65 and older and children, $12. Scarsdale High School. (914) 472-1727.
Music and Dance

BREWSTER -- Christine Smith, flutist; Mark Delpriora, guitarist; and Deborah Horne, soprano, perform works by Copland, Handel and others. Presented by Doansburg Chamber Ensemble. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $9; students and people 62 and older, $8. Trinity Lutheran Church. (845) 228-4167.
CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Michael Skelly, pianist, and Claire Temin, flutist, play music by Bach, Poulenc and others. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.
DOBBS FERRY -- Lou Donaldson Quartet. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Waterfront Park. (914) 631-1000.
ELMSFORD -- Glen Miller Orchestra with the Moonlight Serenaders. Tomorrow at 8 p.m., with dinner at 6. Tickets: $55. Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.
FORDHAM -- Popular band marches performed by brass quintet. Presented by Bronx Arts Ensemble. Today at 4 p.m. Free. McGinley Center, Fordham University, Bronx Rose Hill Campus. (718) 601-7399.
GOLDENS BRIDGE -- Folk dancing led by Rose and Meir Beer. Friday at 8:30 p.m. Admission: $6. Goldens Bridge Community Center Barn, Hall Avenue. (914) 232-1862.
KATONAH -- Jazz by Jimmy Hill Quartet. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Garden of Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

KATONAH -- Caramoor Virtuosi with works by Mendelssohn, Dvorak and Shostakovitch. Thursday at 4:30 p.m. Tickets: $15. Caramoor Virtuosi and Leon Fleisher, pianist, with works by Mozart, Schulhoff and Brahms. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25. ''Festival Finale,'' with Caramoor Virtuosi Orchestra; Leon Fleisher, pianist; Alexander Kerr and Steven Copes, violinists; and Peter Oundjian, conductor. Works by Bach, Mozart and Bartok. Next Saturday at 8:30 p.m., with preconcert program at 7:15. Tickets: $15 to $45. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road. (914) 232-1252.
MOUNT VERNON -- Organ recital. Thursday at 11 a.m. Free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.
NEW ROCHELLE -- Auditions for opera festival scheduled in late September. Sponsored by New Rochelle Opera. Tomorrow at 7:30 p.m. By appointment. New Rochelle Public Library. (914) 576-0365.

NORTH SALEM -- ''Moon Viewing Party'' with classical koto and shakuhachi flute music played by Masayo Ishiguri and Shogi Mizimoto in the lantern-lighted Japanese Stroll Garden. Next Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $25; members, $15. With Japanese-style dinner on the terrace at 6:30 p.m. Tickets: $100; members, $75. Reservations. Hammond Museum, top of Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.
NYACK -- Jazz by Burr Johnson Bank Trio. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Hopper House Art Center, 82 North Broadway. (845) 358-0774.

PAWLING -- Scott Sylvester and the trio Von Em. Tonight at 8. Tickets: $17.50; members, $15. Leo Kottke. Next Friday and Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $30; members, $27.50. Towne Crier Cafe, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.
RIVERDALE -- Brass quintet plays popular marches. Today at 2 p.m. Free. Rockwood Drive Circle, Van Cortlandt Park. (718) 601-7399.
RYE -- Dance to the music of the Milt Gerver Orchestra. Friday at 7:30 to 11 p.m. Parking: $4. Playland Park. (914) 925-2700.
SCARSDALE -- Summer-sing of Bach's Mass in B minor; Clara Longstreth, conductor. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Admission: $8. Scarsdale High School. (914) 693-0990.
SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Carmen Leggio, tenor saxophonist, and His Quartet. Thursday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Kingsland Point Park. (914) 631-1000.

TARRYTOWN -- Summit music festival continues with Christina Khimm, violinist; Eugene Bekker, violist; and Eric Ewazen and Jungeun Kim, pianists. Works by Ewazen, Mozart, Bruch and Foote. Tonight at 8. Matia Zappa, cellist, and Massilmiliano Mainolfi, pianist, with works by Casella, Beethoven and Prokofiev. Tomorrow at 4:30 p.m. Pavel Nersessian, pianist, with works by Bach-Busoni, Schubert-Liszt, Wagner-Liszt and Verdi-Liszt. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Julian Milkis, clarinetist; Vladislav Kovalsky, pianist; Alexandre Brussilovsky and Mark Lakirovich, violinists; and Matia Zappa, cellist, with works by Musgroave, Ustvolskaya and Mozart. Tuesday at 8 p.m. ''Glory of Russian Music and Russian Pianism,'' lecture by David Dubal. Followed by Jung-Kuang Lin, pianist, playing works by Scriabin, Rachmaninoff and Medtner. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Efrem Briskin, pianist; Jacob Gilman, violinist; Emmanuel Feldman, cellist, and Pascale Delache-Feldman, string bassist. Works by Bach, Kodaly, Offenbach and Schubert. Thursday at 8 p.m. Summit Music Festival Orchestra, with Benjamin Bowman, violin soloist; Eugene Bekker, conductor. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15 each; students and people 62 and older, $10. (Student chamber music gala. Friday at 8 p.m. Student recitals. Next Saturday at 4:30 p.m. Free.) Rita Hall, Marymount College. (914) 323-7301.
Art

DOBBS FERRY -- Paintings of Manhattan, people at work and play and portraits and studies of heads by Ralph Fasanella. Opening reception today from 5:30 to 8 p.m. Through Sept. 17. Main Street Gallery, 26 Main Street. (914) 674-9171.

KATONAH -- ''Maine and the Modern Spirit,'' featuring works by Edward Hopper, George Bellows, Marsden Hartley, Carl Sprinchorn and others. Through Sept. 24. ''Sites Unseen,'' outdoor shed-like sculpture by Emily Feinstein. Through Oct. 1. Guided tours. Tuesdays through Sundays at 2:30 p.m. Free with museum admission: $3; members and children, free. Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

MOUNT KISCO -- Visual arts faculty exhibit, with acrylics, watercolors, oils, ceramics and more. Opening reception Friday at 6 p.m. Through Sept. 18. Northern Westchester Center for the Arts, 272 North Bedford Road. (914) 241-6922.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Art works by Karen Sevell Greenbaum, Lenni Hirsch, Irene Pastarnack, Deborah Semel and Don Young. Opens tomorrow. Through Sept. 5. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.
PEEKSKILL -- ''Monhegan Island: the 50's and 60's,'' watercolors by Bohdan Osyczka. Through next Sunday. Flat Iron Gallery, 105 South Division Street. (914) 734-1894.
YONKERS -- Paintings and poems by Meg Lindsay. Through Aug. 16. Sarah Lawrence College library. (914) 337-0700.
Lectures

YONKERS -- ''Ice-Sailing on the Hudson,'' slide show for people 62 and older, by Reid Beilenberg. Wednesday at 1:30 p.m. Free with museum admission: $1.50. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
Films
PEEKSKILL -- ''Croupier.'' Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Admission: $9. Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.
Children

BEDFORD -- Vigorous hike to the farthest reaches of the sanctuary. Program for children 7 and older and adults. Today at 2 p.m. Free. Camp cooking extravaganza, with participants helping to prepare, cook and consume camp foods. Next Saturday at 3:30 p.m. Cost: $5, members, $4. Registration deadline, Thursday. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

BRONX PARK -- Outdoor summer train show, with model trains passing lush plants and traversing streams, a waterfall, tunnels, bridges, a castle and Laura Ingalls Wilder's little house on the prairie, the farmhouse of Grant Wood's ''American Gothic,'' Will Rogers's birthplace and home models. Also popular mazes, hands-on plant science discovery activities and more. Tuesdays through Sundays from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. Garden passport, featuring grounds admission, conservatory, rock and native plant gardens, tram tour and children's garden: $10; students and people 62 and older, $7.50; children 2 through 12, $4. New York Botanical Garden, 200th Street and Kazimiroff Boulevard. (718) 817-8700.

CROSS RIVER -- Ward Pound Ridge Reservation offers an orienteering course for people of all ages willing to learn how to navigate an outdoor course using a map and a compass. There is also a minicourse for beginners, with participants able to borrow a compass and a laminated map. Maps for more difficult courses are $1.50. Wednesdays through Sundays from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Parking: $7; with county parks pass, $3.50. Route 121, off Route 35. (914) 763-3993.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Show by singer and musician, Graham Clarke. For children 8 and younger. Tuesday at 4 p.m. Family members dance to calypso, pop, jazz and classical music, performed by the steel band Steel Passion. Friday at 7:30 p.m. ''World of Magic,'' family show with David Levitan. Next Saturday at 7 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.

GREENBURGH -- ''Tropical Fest,'' Caribbean songs, dances and stories with Conroy Warren. Today at 6 p.m., with picnicking at 5:30. Cost: $6; members, $4. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.
MAMARONECK -- Family magic show. Sponsored by Village of Mamaroneck Council of the Arts. Tonight at 7. Free. Harbor Island Park.
MAMARONECK -- ''Treasure Island,'' presented by Missoula Children's Theater. Next Saturday at 11 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. Tickets: $12; members, $8. Emelin Theater, Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Haitian dances and songs, for children 6 and older and adults. Presented by Westchester Haitian Community Services. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. ''Making Fun and Nutritious Snacks.'' Friday at 1:30 p.m. Registration. Both free. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.

RIVERDALE -- Family members create their own sunglasses. Today from 1 to 4 p.m. View flying butterflies, then make a butterfly hat to wear. Next Saturday and Sunday from 1 to 4 p.m. Admission: $4; students and people 62 and older, $2; children 5 and younger, free. Wave Hill, West 249th Street and Independence Avenue. (718) 549-3200.

RYE -- County swimming championships. Tomorrow through Thursday from 5 p.m. to finish. Spectators: $2; children, $1; four-day pass, $6; children, $3. Parking, additional $4. Fireworks display. Wednesdays and Fridays at 9:15 p.m. Through Sept. 1. Parking, $4. Playland Park. (914) 925-2700.

YONKERS -- Tales of the Hudson River, by storyteller, Johnathan Kruk. Today at 1:30 p.m. $1 and museum admission additional: $4; people 62 and older and children, $3. Schedule of sky shows for children 8 and older and adults: ''Sky Tonight.'' Saturdays and Sundays at 1:30 p.m. ''Earth and Sky.'' Today at 3:30 p.m. ''Guided by the Sky.'' Next Saturday and Sunday at 3:30 p.m. ''Rusty Rocket's Last Blast,'' show for children 6 and older. Saturdays and Sundays at 2:30 p.m. Cost: $4 each; people 62 and older and children, $3. Admission to galleries and one planetarium show: $7; people 62 and older and children, $5. ''Sky Tonight.'' Fridays at 7 p.m. Free tickets at front desk, beginning at 6:30. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
YONKERS -- The film ''Stuart Little.'' Tuesday at 6 p.m. Free. Crestwood Branch of Yonkers Public Library. (914) 337-1500.
Potpourri
BEDFORD -- Visit wildflowers in the field. Wear long pants. Next Sunday at 10:30 a.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

GARRISON -- Guided tours of Boscobel Restoration, the 19th-century Federal-style home of States Morris Dyckman, a Loyalist during the American Revolution. Daily, except Tuesdays from 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m., with last tour at 4:15. Admission: $8; people 60 and older, $7; children 6 through 14, $5; younger children, free. Grounds only pass: $5; children 6 through 14, $3. 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-3638.

HASTINGS-ON-HUDSON -- ''Taking Care of Business,'' exhibition celebrating female entrepreneurs who started businesses like The Enterprise, Fabric Shelf, Feedback Factory and Good Yarns Bookstore in Hastingsthe 1970's. Mondays and Thursdays at 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Through August. Hastings Historical Society's Observatory Cottage, Draper Park, 407 Broadway. (914) 478-2249.

KATONAH -- Guided house tours of John Jay Homestead. Wednesdays through Saturdays from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. and Sundays from noon to 4 p.m., beginning every hour. Admission: $3; people 60 and older, $2; children, $1. Outdoor walking tours, weather permitting. Sundays at 2:30 p.m. Free. 400 Jay Street, Route 22. (914) 232-5651.

NEW CITY -- ''Leaving Her Mark: Contributions of Rockland's Women,'' exhibition highlighting the contributions of talented Rockland women from the 18th century to the 21st century; from suffrage to medicine and politics. Tuesdays through Sundays from 1 to 5 p.m. Through Sept. 13. Donation: $4, including guided tour of Jacob Blauvelt House by costumed guide; children, $3. Historical Society of Rockland County, 20 Zukor Road. (845) 634-9645.
NEW ROCHELLE -- Mini-book sale. Friday at 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.

SCARSDALE -- Current exhibition, ''The Real McCoy: A Legacy of African-American Innovation.'' Today from 2 to 4 p.m., Wednesday through Friday from 1:30 to 4 p.m. and next Sunday from 2 to 4 p.m. Admission: $1.50; students and people 65 and older, $1. Free admission today only. Scarsdale Historical Society Museum, 937 White Plains Post Road. (914) 723-1744.
